text:
104-108 East 60th Street, adjoining the S.E. corner of Park Ave.
About 1913.

106-112 East 60th Street, east of, adjoining, and at the S.E. corner of Park Avenue.
About 1914.

International News.

106-112 East 60th Street, adjoining the S.E. corner of Park Avenue.

About 1915 .

Gift of E. M. Jenks.

No. 515 Park Avenue, on S. E. corner Park Avenue and 60th Street, an
apartment building erected about 1911.  About 1923.
Neg: 2731
THE NEW YORK
PUBLIC LIBRARY
ASTOR, LENOX AND
TILDEN FOUNDATIONS

Park Avenue, west side, north from E. 60th St., showing mainly the demolition of No. 520, an apartment building at the N. W. corner. This was erected in 1911, and is to be replaced by the new Christ Church, M. E. The photographer's vantage point for the extensive view is E. 59th Street. View 2 is of earlier date and includes the apartment building at the S. W. corner of 61st Street. This came down prior to No. 520 and the site remained vacant for years. The N. Y. Times of January 18, 1940 reports the proposed improvement of this location with a modern 19 story apartment building. View 3 is westward on 60th St. during demolition of No. 520. The Hotel Pierre appears to the left.

View 1- October 21, 1930
View 2- September 11, 1928
View 3- October 21, 1930

P. L. Sperr

View 2- September 11, 1928
View 3- October 21, 1930

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, west side, north from East 60th St., showing the cleared 60th-61st Street frontage and apartment buildings north of same. The prominent 12 story white structure is No. 540 Park Avenue (erected 1908) and is at the N. W. corner of E. 61st Street. Adjoining to the north is the 17 story apartment building, No. 550 Park Ave., a structure over shadowing the Colonial faced Colony Club.

December 21st, 1930
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, west side, north from East 60th St., showing the cleared 60th-61st Street frontage and apartment buildings north of same. The prominent 12 story white structure is No. 540 Park Avenue (erected 1908) and is at the N. W. corner of E. 61st Street. Adjoining to the north is the 17 story apartment building, No. 550 Park Ave., a structure over shadowing the Colonial faced Colony Club.

December 21st, 1930
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, at East 60th Street, showing two corners of same as viewed eastward on the street and across the Avenue. The cleared site will be improved with the new Christ Church. The apartment building shown is No. 521 Park (erected 1911) and is at the N.W. corner. The Grolier Society Clubhouse is at the left, the darkly shown.

December 21, 1930

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, at East 60th Street, showing two corners of same as viewed eastward on the street and across the Avenue. The cleared site will be improved with the new Christ Church. The apartment building shown is No. 521 Park (erected 1911) and is at the N.W. corner. The Grolier Society Clubhouse is at the left, the darkly shown.

December 21, 1930

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, west side, from East 60th (left) to 61st (right) Streets, showing an entire blockfront clearance. The photographer is viewing generally westward towards 5th Ave. and where (in Views 1&2) appear the Hotels Savoy Plaza and the Sherry Netherland. View 3 shows the southeasterly side of the Grolier Society Club building. Christ Church (M. E.) will rise at the southerly half of this site and the balance will not be erected upon until 1940. For further data see other views.

December 21, 1930
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, west side, from East 60th (left) to 61st (right) Streets, showing an entire blockfront clearance. The photographer is viewing generally westward towards 5th Ave. and where (in Views 1&2) appear the Hotels Savoy Plaza and the Sherry Netherland. View 3 shows the southeasterly side of the Grolier Society Club building. Christ Church (M. E.) will rise at the southerly half of this site and the balance will not be erected upon until 1940. For further data see other views.

December 21, 1930
Views 1,2,3

Park Avenue, west side, from East 60th (left) to 61st (right) Streets, showing an entire blockfront clearance. View 3 shows the southeasterly side of the Grolier Society Club building. Christ Church (M. E.) will rise at the southerly half of this site and the balance will not be erected upon until 1940. For further data see other views.

December 21, 1930
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, west side, south from East 61st Street, showing the 61st to 60th Street clearance and apartment buildings south of same. The photographer is on the east side of this thoroughfare and is viewing southwestward across the longitudinal parks that divide the traffic. To the left top appears the tower of the Hotel Delmonico, a structure at the N. W. corner of this avenue and E. 59th Street.
View No. 3 slightly earlier and is limited to show the cleared S. W. corner of 61st Street. Note to the left here, the apartment building No. 520 Park Avenue that is absent in the other views. This was demolished to provide a site for Christ Church, M. E. Through the center appears the spire of the Hotel Sherry-Netherland on 5th Ave.
The N. Y. Times of January 18, 1940 reports the proposed erection of a 19 story apartment building, to adjoin the Church, replacing the tennis courts that have long occupied the vacant corner site at E. 61st Street.
Views 1-2 December 21, 1930
View 3 May 3, 1930

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, west side, south from East 61st Street, showing the 61st to 60th Street clearance and apartment buildings south of same. The photographer is on the east side of this thoroughfare and is viewing southwestward across the longitudinal parks that divide the traffic. To the left top appears the tower of the Hotel Delmonico, a structure at the N. W. corner of this avenue and E. 59th Street.
View No. 3 slightly earlier and is limited to show the cleared S. W. corner of 61st Street. Note to the left here, the apartment building No. 520 Park Avenue that is absent in the other views. The N. Y. Times of January 18, 1940 reports the proposed erection of a 19 story apartment building, to adjoin the Church, replacing the tennis courts that have long occupied the vacant corner site at E. 61st Street.

View 3 May 3, 1930

View 3 May 3, 1930

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, at East 61st Street as viewed north-eastward from atop the Grolier Society Clubhouse (47-49 E.60 Street) and across the cleared Brearley School site (S. W. corner of 61st Street) to show mainly the 15 and 12 story apartment houses that are respectively, No's. 535 & 555 Park Avenue. These occupy the east frontage, from 61st to 62nd Streets.

View No.1 emphasizes the 12 story building (No. 540) at the N. W. corner of 61st Street and is photographed from the same point of vantage.

May 13, 1930
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, at East 61st Street as viewed north-eastward from atop the Grolier Society Clubhouse (47-49 E.60 Street) and across the cleared Brearley School site (S. W. corner of 61st Street) to show mainly the 15 and 12 story apartment houses that are respectively, No's. 535 & 555 Park Avenue. These occupy the east frontage, from 61st to 62nd Streets.

View No.1 emphasizes the 12 story building (No. 540) at the N. W. corner of 61st Street and is photographed from the same point of vantage.

May 13, 1930
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

Park Avenue, at East 61st Street as viewed north-eastward from atop the Grolier Society Clubhouse (47-49 E.60 Street) and across the cleared Brearley School site (S. W. corner of 61st Street) to show mainly the 15 and 12 story apartment houses that are respectively, No's. 535 & 555 Park Avenue. These occupy the east frontage, from 61st to 62nd Streets.

View No.1 emphasizes the 12 story building (No. 540) at the N. W. corner of 61st Street and is photographed from the same point of vantage.

May 13, 1930
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

Park Ave., east side, south from, but not including East 60th Street. Prominent building shown, is the Ritz Tower.

June 11, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

Park Avenue, west side, from E. 60th to 61st Streets, showing Christ Church (M. E.) and the Park Avenue Tennis Club. The church, a new edifice of the congregation of the Madison Avenue M. E. Church is at the N. W. corner of 60th Street and replaced an apartment house (erected in 1911 and demolished in 1930). The tennis courts are where the Brearley School formerly stood (also cleared in 1930). Upon this site (N. Y. Times of Jan. 18, 1940) will rise a 19 story apartment house. Note the Savoy Plaza Hotel in the center background.

August 13, 1936

P. L. Sperr

Park Ave., at the N.W. corner of East 60th Street, showing Christ Church (new edifice for the former Madison Ave. M.E. Church which stood at the N.E. corner of Madison Ave. and East 60th Street).

August 4, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

Park Avenue, south from and including 60th Street, showing east side of Avenue.
Compare with Galloway's picture of the same view but taken nearer the ground, in 1930.
1923-1924.
Ewing Galloway,Photographer.
